titlestmt.titleproper: Reverend Carl T. Smith collection undated
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

scopecontent.p: The collection contains genealogical and research materials compiled by Reverend Carl T. Smith. Materials include tombstone inscriptions from cemeteries in Berks, Chester, Mifflin, Montgomery and other Pennsylvania counties; transcriptions of baptism records from the German Reformed Congregation of Northern Liberties (translated into English); and very simple hand-drawn maps (originals and photocopies) pertaining to early land in Berks and Montgomery county. It is likely that some of these materials have been microfilmed (XCh 75 and also Be/IM).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
